Operation 'AddIpToAllowList' has semantic quality issues: missing_output_details, missing_side_effects. Description lacks explicit information about the response format and the side effect that added IPs immediately gain access permissions. Enhanced description clarifies what is returned and the security implications of the operation for better AI agent decision-making.

data.current_summary: Add one or more IPs to the allow list
data.current_description:
**This endpoint allows you to add one or more allowed IP addresses.**

To allow one or more IP addresses, pass them to this endpoint in an array. Once an IP address is added to your allow list, it will be assigned an `id` that can be used to remove the address. You can retrieve the ID associated with an IP using the "Retrieve a list of currently allowed IPs" endpoint.
data.description_suggestion: Adds one or more IP addresses to your account's allow list. Submit an array of IP addresses in the request body. Each added IP will be assigned a unique `id` for future reference or removal. Returns the created IP address entries with their assigned IDs and timestamps. Once added, these IPs will be permitted to access your account through the SendGrid UI or API.
data.reasoning: Description lacks explicit information about the response format and the side effect that added IPs immediately gain access permissions. Enhanced description clarifies what is returned and the security implications of the operation for better AI agent decision-making.

message: Operation 'DeleteAllowedIps' has semantic quality issues: missing_output_details, missing_side_effects. While the description includes important security warnings, it lacks explicit information about the response format and doesn't clearly state the immediate side effect of access revocation. Enhanced description clarifies the response, emphasizes the critical security implications, and provides clear guidance for AI agents to understand the high-risk nature of this operation.

data.current_summary: Remove one or more IPs from the allow list
data.current_description:
**This endpoint allows you to remove one or more IP addresses from your list of allowed addresses.**

To remove one or more IP addresses, pass this endpoint an array containing the ID(s) associated with the IP(s) you intend to remove. You can retrieve the IDs associated with your allowed IP addresses using the "Retrieve a list of currently allowed IPs" endpoint.

It is possible to remove your own IP address, which will block access to your account. You will need to submit a [support ticket](https://sendgrid.com/docs/ui/account-and-settings/support/) if this happens. For this reason, it is important to double check that you are removing only the IPs you intend to remove when using this endpoint.
data.description_suggestion: Removes one or more IP addresses from your account's allow list. Submit an array of IP address IDs in the request body to delete. Returns a success response upon completion. **Critical:** Removing your own IP will immediately block your access to the account. Verify the IDs before submission. If you accidentally remove your own IP, contact SendGrid support to restore access.
data.reasoning: While the description includes important security warnings, it lacks explicit information about the response format and doesn't clearly state the immediate side effect of access revocation. Enhanced description clarifies the response, emphasizes the critical security implications, and provides clear guidance for AI agents to understand the high-risk nature of this operation.

message: Operation 'GetAllowedIp' has semantic quality issues: missing_input_details, missing_output_details. Description has a typo ('retreive') and lacks clarity about the response structure. Enhanced description specifies the required path parameter name, clarifies what information is returned, and improves AI agent understanding of the operation's inputs and outputs.

data.current_description:
**This endpoint allows you to retreive a specific IP address that has been allowed to access your account.**

You must include the ID for the specific IP address you want to retrieve in your call. You can retrieve the IDs associated with your allowed IP addresses using the "Retrieve a  list of currently allowed IPs" endpoint.
data.description_suggestion: Retrieves details for a specific allowed IP address using its unique ID. Requires the `rule_id` path parameter identifying the IP entry. Returns the IP address details including creation and modification timestamps. Use the ListAllowedIp operation to obtain available rule IDs.
data.reasoning: Description has a typo ('retreive') and lacks clarity about the response structure. Enhanced description specifies the required path parameter name, clarifies what information is returned, and improves AI agent understanding of the operation's inputs and outputs.

message: Operation 'DeleteAllowedIp' has semantic quality issues: missing_output_details, missing_side_effects. Description lacks explicit information about the response format and critical side effects of IP removal. Enhanced description clarifies the required parameter, response format, and emphasizes the immediate access revocation consequence, enabling AI agents to understand the operation's impact and potential risks.

data.current_summary: Remove a specific IP from the allowed list
data.current_description:
**This endpoint allows you to remove a specific IP address from your list of allowed addresses.**

When removing a specific IP address from your list, you must include the ID in your call.  You can retrieve the IDs associated with your allowed IP addresses using the "Retrieve a list of currently allowed IPs" endpoint.
data.description_suggestion: Removes a specific IP address from your account's allow list using its unique ID. Requires the `rule_id` path parameter. Returns a success response upon completion. The removed IP will immediately lose access permissions to your account. If you remove your own IP, contact SendGrid support to restore access.
data.reasoning: Description lacks explicit information about the response format and critical side effects of IP removal. Enhanced description clarifies the required parameter, response format, and emphasizes the immediate access revocation consequence, enabling AI agents to understand the operation's impact and potential risks.
